items.label: cor-vvarx-to-high-error-fraction
items.title: A Large Intra-Swarm Positional Variance Guarantees a Non-Vanishing High-Error Fraction
items.content:
2841: :label: cor-vvarx-to-high-error-fraction
2842: 
2843: For any fixed interaction range $\varepsilon > 0$, there exists a positional variance threshold $R^2_{\text{total\_var},x} > 0$ and a corresponding N-uniform constant $f_H(\epsilon) > 0$ such that:
2844: 
2845: If the total intra-swarm positional variance is large, $V_{\text{Var},x} > R^2_{\text{total\_var},x}$, then the fraction of *alive* walkers in the unified high-error set of at least one of the swarms, $k \in {1, 2}$, is bounded below:
2846: 
2847: $$
2848: \frac{|H_k(\epsilon)|}{k} \ge f_H(\epsilon) > 0
2849: $$
items.section: ## 6. The Geometry of Error: From System Error to a Guaranteed Geometric Structure
items.raw_directive:
2838: This corollary provides the final, synthesized result of our geometric analysis. It proves that a large **total intra-swarm positional variance ($V_{\text{Var},x}$)** is sufficient to guarantee that a non-vanishing fraction of at least one of the swarms belongs to this high-error set, providing the clean, unified input required for the subsequent analysis. This directly aligns with the Keystone Principle's central thesis: the cloning operator contracts the positional variance component of the Lyapunov function.
2839:

items.label: cor-cloning-pressure-target-set
items.title: Cloning Pressure on the Target Set
items.content:
5049: :label: cor-cloning-pressure-target-set
5050: 
5051: For any walker $i$ in the **critical target set** (see {prf:ref}`def-critical-target-set`), $I_{\text{target}} = I_{11} \cap U_k \cap H_k(\epsilon)$, its total cloning probability in the high-variance swarm $k$ is also bounded below by the same N-uniform constant:
5052: 
5053: $$
5054: p_{k,i} \ge p_u(\epsilon) > 0
5055: $$
items.raw_directive:
5046: This powerful lemma guarantees that every walker identified as "unfit" is under significant, quantifiable pressure to be cloned. We can now extend this guarantee directly to our critical target population.
5047: 
5048: :::{prf:corollary} Cloning Pressure on the Target Set
5049: :label: cor-cloning-pressure-target-set
5050: 
5051: For any walker $i$ in the **critical target set** (see {prf:ref}`def-critical-target-set`), $I_{\text{target}} = I_{11} \cap U_k \cap H_k(\epsilon)$, its total cloning probability in the high-variance swarm $k$ is also bounded below by the same N-uniform constant:
5052: 
5053: $$
5054: p_{k,i} \ge p_u(\epsilon) > 0
5055: $$

items.title: Structural Error Contraction
items.content:
6907: :label: cor-structural-error-contraction
6908: 
6909: Under the same conditions as {prf:ref}`thm-positional-variance-contraction`, the structural error also contracts:
6910: 
6911: $$
6912: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{struct}}(S'_1, S'_2)] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{struct}}) V_{\text{struct}}(S_1, S_2) + C_{\text{struct}}
6913: $$

items.label: cor-bounded-boundary-exposure
items.title: Bounded Boundary Exposure in Equilibrium
items.content:
7609: :label: cor-bounded-boundary-exposure
7610: 
7611: Under the drift inequality from {prf:ref}`thm-boundary-potential-contraction`, the long-term boundary exposure is bounded:
7612: 
7613: $$
7614: \limsup_{t \to \infty} \mathbb{E}[W_b(S_t)] \leq \frac{C_b}{\kappa_b}
7615: $$
7616: 
7617: This provides a **state-independent upper bound** on how close the swarm can get to the boundary in equilibrium.

items.label: cor-extinction-suppression
items.title: Exponentially Suppressed Extinction Probability
items.content:
7654: :label: cor-extinction-suppression
7655: 
7656: As a consequence of {prf:ref}`thm-boundary-potential-contraction`, the boundary potential contraction exponentially suppresses the probability of catastrophic boundary crossing events. Specifically, for any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists $N_0$ such that for all $N > N_0$:
7657: 
7658: $$
7659: P(\text{extinction in one step}) = O(e^{-N \cdot \text{const}})
7660: $$

items.label: cor-component-bounds-vw
items.title: Component-Wise Bounds on Inter-Swarm Error
items.content:
8036: :label: cor-component-bounds-vw
8037: 
8038: As a decomposition of {prf:ref}`thm-inter-swarm-bounded-expansion`, the location and structural error components satisfy:
8039: 
8040: $$
8041: \begin{aligned}
8042: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{loc}}] &\leq C_{\text{loc}} \\
8043: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{struct}}] &\leq C_{\text{struct}}
8044: \end{aligned}
8045: $$
8046: 
8047: where $C_{\text{loc}}, C_{\text{struct}} < \infty$ are state-independent constants with $C_W = C_{\text{loc}} + C_{\text{struct}}$.
items.raw_directive:
